content.text: In February, 12 goals are scored
Complete the bar chart
How many more goals were scored in January than in October?
The bar chart shows the number of goals scored by a team in each of 5 months
Find the range of the number of goals scored
The team shop is open from 09:00 to 17:15 on Monday to Friday only
Work out how long the shop is open each week
Give your answer in hours and minutes
Bruno buys a shirt for $36 and a scarf for $12.25
He pays with a $50 note
Work out how much change he receives
Calculate the cost of 150 adult tickets, 70 child tickets and 30 senior tickets
Calculate the percentage of these tickets that are senior tickets
A game starts at 15 00
The team plays for 90 minutes
There is also a break of 15 minutes
Find the time the game ends
Write down the mathematical name for this polygon
Write down the mathematical name for this quadrilateral
Measure the size of this angle
Write the number fourteen thousand and ninety-seven in figures
Write down a common multiple of 17 and 5
Write 0.25 as a percentage
Find the value of
Ranjit buys some plants and sells \(\frac{5}{11}\) of them
He sells 190 plants
Work out how many plants he buys
Factorise completely
Make \(n\) the subject of the formula \(V = 3n + t\)
Find the value of \(x\)
Complete the table of values for \(y = x^{2} - 4x - 2\)
On the grid, draw the graph of \(y = x^{2} - 4x - 2\) for \(-2 \leqslant x \leqslant 5\)
Use your graph to solve the equation \(x^{2} - 4x - 2 = 0\)
How many cars are red?
35 cars are grey
Show, by calculation, that the sector angle for grey is \(25.2^{\circ}\)
175 cars are white and 150 cars are black
Complete the pie chart to show this information
Find the probability that a car chosen at random is **not** grey
Give your answer as a fraction in its simplest form
Another 320 cars cross the bridge
How many of these 320 cars are expected to be white?
Heidi also records the number of people in each car crossing the bridge for one hour
Calculate the mean
Heidi records the colour of each of 500 cars crossing a bridge
The pie chart shows some of this information
Simplify
Simplify
The perimeter of this shape is equal to the perimeter of a square
Find an expression for the length of one side of the square
Give your answer in its simplest form
Victoria buys 5 cups of tea and 4 cakes for \(15.69\)
Isabella buys 3 cups of tea and 7 cakes for \(17.97\)
Write down a pair of simultaneous equations and solve them to find the cost of one cup of tea and the cost of one cake
You must show all your working
Tea $
Elize invests \(\)5000
Lily invests \(\)8000
Marco invests \(\)3000
After one year they make a profit of \(\)40\ 000
They share this profit in the ratio of their investments
Work out how much they each receive

Lily $

Lily buys 20 rolls of ribbon
8 are red, 6 are blue, 4 are yellow and 2 are pink
A roll of ribbon is chosen at random
On the probability scale, draw an arrow \((\downarrow)\) to show the probability that this roll is
The length, \(l \text{m}\), of a roll of ribbon is \(120 \text{m}\), correct to the nearest metre
Complete this statement about the value of \(l\)
green
Elize, Lily and Marco start a business
**Using a ruler and compasses only**, construct triangle \(RST\)
Leave in your construction arcs
The line \(RS\) has been drawn for you
Measure the distance from \(S\) to the midpoint of \(RT\)
Give your answer in millimetres
In triangle \(RST\), \(RT = 7 \text{cm}\) and \(ST = 4 \text{cm}\)
Town \(A\) is \(8.5 \text{cm}\) from town \(B\) on a map
The scale of the map is \(1:50 000\)
Calculate the actual distance from town \(A\) to town \(B\)
Give your answer in kilometres
The diagram shows triangle \(BCE\) and a straight line \(ABCD\)
\(BE = CE\) and angle \(DCE = 118^\circ\)
Find the value of \(x\)
The diagram shows a right-angled triangle \(ABC\)
Show that \(BC\) is \(7.5 \text{cm}\), correct to 2 significant figures
Describe fully the **single** transformation that maps triangle \(A\) onto triangle \(B\)
Describe fully the **single** transformation that maps triangle \(A\) onto triangle \(C\)
On the grid, translate triangle \(A\) by the vector \(\left( \begin{array}{c}6\\ -4 \end{array} \right)\)
On the grid, reflect triangle \(A\) in the line \(y = - 2\)
Triangles \(A, B\) and \(C\) are shown on the grid
